paper_abstract: In this paper using the global Hurst exponent, the impact of privatization of public companies in Iran on the degree of efficiency in Tehran Stock Exchange is assessed. The results show that selling public companies' share in Tehran Stock Exchange (TSE) leads to a structural break in degree of market development. To model this phenomenon a catastrophe approach is used and it is demonstrated that this structural break can be better explained by a cusp catastrophe model.
paper_title: MODELING THE EFFECT OF PRIVATIZATION ON BEHAVIOR OF HURST EXPONENT USING STOCHASTIC CATASTROPHE THEORY
